byline.contributor: Nikita Stewart reported from Charleston, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Alan Blinder and Frances Robles contributed reporting from Charleston, Campbell Robertson from Shreveport, La., Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Erik Eckholm from New York.
byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Relatives of nine black men and women killed at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC, confront gunman Dylann Roof with mixture of grief and forgiveness; families' reactions during Roof's bond hearing offer moments of grace during proceedings centered on horrific act.
lead_paragraph: Relatives of people killed in a shooting at a black church addressed the suspect, Dylann Roof, in court on Friday, tearfully offering forgiveness, and hope that he would confess and repent.

headline.main: In Charleston, Raw Emotion at Hearing for Suspect in Church Shooting
headline.print_headline: ‘I Will Never Be Able to Hold Her Again. But I Forgive You.’
